snippet: The Children’s Health Insurance Program, known as CHIP, has helped cut in half the uninsured rate for children, but its funding is set to end in September 2015.
abstract: Senate hearing sets the stage for debate over whether the federal government should continue financing Children’s Health Insurance Program, known as CHIP, for lower-income children who are now eligible for new coverage options under the Affordable Care Act; federal government gives matching funds to states to provide the coverage, but that funding is set to end in September 2015.
lead_paragraph: The Children’s Health Insurance Program, known as CHIP, has helped cut in half the uninsured rate for children, but its funding is set to end in September 2015.

headline.main: Fate of Children’s Insurance Program Is Called Into Question at Senate Hearing
headline.print_headline: Fate of Children’s Insurance Program Is Called Into Question at Senate Hearing

keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
keywords.name: subject
